lines.text: I say we bury the cracker and have dessert.
It's 1909 and you're alone with a young artist named Adolph. Do you kill him?
People disappear all of the time.
Especially in Iowa. We probably saved him from an alien abduction.
We've got to call the police. They'll understand.
Sure they would. Grad student kills war hero with a knife. You'll probably just get a ticket.
The conservatives are effective. They do things. All we do is buy animal-friendly mascara.
I'm the first to admit we took this country from the indians but what were they doing with it anyway; shooting off bows and arrows and using seashells for money.
"Thumbelina" is art. "Catcher in the Rye" is just mean-spirited garbage littered with the, oh, the "F" word.
What if you kill somebody whose death makes the world a better place?
You know what you need Heather? You know what you really need? A nice stiff dick to shut that big mouth of yours.
Liberals, never taking a stand you'd be willing to...
Nah. Boy, dying is easy. There is nothing heroic about dying. But if you can take a stand for something you'd be willing to kill for, that is something, something special
Is it crazy to make a difference?
Look, we're liberals. We do the right thing.
